lines.gurmukhi: pUrn bRhm gur pUrn ikRpw kY dIno; swcu aupdysu irdY inhcl miq hY [

Unknown.translation: Perfect Guru, embodiment of complete Lord becoming kind lodges true sermon in the heart of a disciple of the Guru. That makes him stable of intelligence and saves him from wanderings.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq ilv lIn jl mIn Bey; pUrn srbmeI pY iGRq jugiq hY [

Unknown.translation: Engrossed in the word, his condition becomes like that of a fish enjoying the bliss of his surroundings. He then realises the presence of God in everyone just as fat, that is present in all milks.

lines.gurmukhi: swcu irdY swcu dyKY sunY bolY gMD rs; spUrn prspr BwvnI Bgiq hY [

Unknown.translation: God, the true Master resides in the heart of a Sikh who is ever engrossed in the word of the Guru. He sees the presence of the Lord everywhere. He hears Him with his ears, enjoys the sweet smell of His presence with his nostrils, and relishes the name of

lines.gurmukhi: pUrn bRhm dRumu swKw pqR PUl Pl; eyk hI Anyk myk siqgur siq hY [276[

Unknown.translation: True Guru who is eternal of form has dispensed this knowledge that just as the seed resides in the trees, plants, branches, flowers etc, one God who is perfect and all-knowing pervades in all. (276)
